Claim: LGBTQ people in the US are demanding to be treated first for coronavirus.
Explaination: Pulpit and Pen quotes a Reuters article about an open letter signed by more than 100 LGBTQ rights groups, calling on organisations handling the global coronavirus pandemic to remember “that LGBTQ+ communities are among those who are particularly vulnerable to the negative health effects of this virus”. But it doesn't ask for anyone to be given priority treatment.
Label: False
html:
Claim: LGBTQ people in the US are demanding to be treated first for coronavirus.

Explanation:Pulpit and Pen quotes a Reuters article about an open letter signed by more than 100 LGBTQ rights groups, calling on organisations handling the global coronavirus pandemic to remember “that LGBTQ+ communities are among those who are particularly vulnerable to the negative health effects of this virus”. But it doesn't ask for anyone to be given priority treatment.

https://africacheck.org/fbcheck/no-lgbtq-people-in-us-havent-demanded-first-treatment-for-covid-19/

Claim: People in Wuhan are locked inside their houses by the Chinese government.
Explaination: The video is of people in wuhan offering their respects to the whistleblower, doctor Li Wenliang.
Label: False
html:
Claim: People in Wuhan are locked inside their houses by the Chinese government.

Explanation:The video is of people in wuhan offering their respects to the whistleblower, doctor Li Wenliang.

https://www.factcrescendo.com/wuhan-people-screaming-for-lives-fact-check/

Claim: COVID-19 Breeds Rapidly In Toilet Paper.
Explaination: Post claiming COVID-19 breeds rapidly in toilet paper is fake. The post is taken from an inauthentic website.
Label: False
html:
Claim: COVID-19 Breeds Rapidly In Toilet Paper.

Explanation:Post claiming COVID-19 breeds rapidly in toilet paper is fake. The post is taken from an inauthentic website.

https://www.vishvasnews.com/english/health/fact-check-post-claiming-covid-19-breeds-rapidly-in-toilet-paper-is-fake/

Claim: An “open letter” purportedly written by US billionaire and philanthropist Bill Gates about the novel coronavirus pandemic has been shared in English and Chinese on Facebook, Twitter and various websites. The Chinese-language posts state the letter was translated from its original publication in British newspaper The Sun.
Explaination: But the letter is fake; Gates’ philanthropic organisation, the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, clarified on Weibo that the letter presents “false information” and urged netizens to stop sharing it. The Sun has reportedly removed the letter from its website.
Label: False
html:
Claim: An “open letter” purportedly written by US billionaire and philanthropist Bill Gates about the novel coronavirus pandemic has been shared in English and Chinese on Facebook, Twitter and various websites. The Chinese-language posts state the letter was translated from its original publication in British newspaper The Sun.

Explanation:But the letter is fake; Gates’ philanthropic organisation, the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, clarified on Weibo that the letter presents “false information” and urged netizens to stop sharing it. The Sun has reportedly removed the letter from its website.

https://factcheck.afp.com/gates-foundation-urges-netizens-stop-sharing-fake-bill-gates-coronavirus-letter

Claim: President Donald Trump tweeted, “I ordered the Treasury secretary to send checks to Americans! First however, we will go through your social media history from the last 4 years and search for any post with #NotMyPresident in it. I wouldn’t think of offending you with a check if I’m not your president! #MAGA”
Explaination: Americans could receive a $1,000 check as part of an economic stimulus package that isn't yet finalized. Donald Trump didn't tweet that he would vet who gets the checks based on whether they support him.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: President Donald Trump tweeted, “I ordered the Treasury secretary to send checks to Americans! First however, we will go through your social media history from the last 4 years and search for any post with #NotMyPresident in it. I wouldn’t think of offending you with a check if I’m not your president! #MAGA”

Explanation:Americans could receive a $1,000 check as part of an economic stimulus package that isn't yet finalized. Donald Trump didn't tweet that he would vet who gets the checks based on whether they support him.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/19/viral-image/no-trump-didnt-tweet-about-1000-checks/

Claim: Dallas student celebrating spring break collapses from coronavirus.
Explaination: Came from fake news generator website.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Dallas student celebrating spring break collapses from coronavirus.

Explanation:Came from fake news generator website.

https://leadstories.com//3471927-Fact-Check-NO-Dallas-Student-Celebrating-Spring-Break-On-South-Padre-Island-Did-NOT-Suddenly-Collapse-From-Coronavirus.html

Claim: President Barack Obama “waited six months to call swine flu an emergency after thousands died.”
Explaination: The Obama administration declared swine flu, or H1N1, a public health emergency six weeks before H1N1 was declared a pandemic. No H1N1 deaths had yet been recorded in the United States.
Label: False
html:
Claim: President Barack Obama “waited six months to call swine flu an emergency after thousands died.”

Explanation:The Obama administration declared swine flu, or H1N1, a public health emergency six weeks before H1N1 was declared a pandemic. No H1N1 deaths had yet been recorded in the United States.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/04/facebook-posts/president-obama-declared-h1n1-public-health-emerge/

Claim: American citizens have placed a nude statue of President Donald Trump in New York City because he failed to handle the coronavirus situation in USA.
Explaination: The video is almost 4 years old and is unrelated to the current Novel coronavirus situation.
Label: False
html:
Claim: American citizens have placed a nude statue of President Donald Trump in New York City because he failed to handle the coronavirus situation in USA.

Explanation:The video is almost 4 years old and is unrelated to the current Novel coronavirus situation.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/04/09/angry-citizens-did-not-place-a-naked-statue-of-trump-in-new-york-city-due-to-his-inability-to-contain-covid-19-situation/

Claim: A video has been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple Facebook, YouTube and Twitter posts alongside a claim it shows the Islamic call to prayer being heard in Spain during the COVID-19 epidemic for the first time in 500 years.
Explaination: The claim is false; the video was filmed in Azerbaijan in November 2019, before the COVID-19 pandemic; there has been no ban on the Islamic call to prayer in Spain in recent times.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video has been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple Facebook, YouTube and Twitter posts alongside a claim it shows the Islamic call to prayer being heard in Spain during the COVID-19 epidemic for the first time in 500 years.

Explanation:The claim is false; the video was filmed in Azerbaijan in November 2019, before the COVID-19 pandemic; there has been no ban on the Islamic call to prayer in Spain in recent times.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-was-filmed-azerbaijan-november-2019

Claim: Event 201 “gave out stuffed souvenir coronavirus toys” to “commemorate” novel coronavirus outbreak.
Explaination: Event 201 used a fictionalized coronavirus outbreak as its pandemic scenario but did not "predict" the outbreak of a strain that would be detected two months later in December 2019 in Wuhan, China.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: Event 201 “gave out stuffed souvenir coronavirus toys” to “commemorate” novel coronavirus outbreak.

Explanation:Event 201 used a fictionalized coronavirus outbreak as its pandemic scenario but did not "predict" the outbreak of a strain that would be detected two months later in December 2019 in Wuhan, China.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/feb/03/facebook-posts/these-plushies-do-not-commemorate-2019-novel-coron/

Claim: Sanitizer manufacturer Dettol knew about the new coronavirus before it was reported.
Explaination: The label of Dettol mentioning that it kills coronavirus is not the recent strain of coronavirus. They have not tested its products for the recent novel coronavirus. Misleading post is getting viral.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Sanitizer manufacturer Dettol knew about the new coronavirus before it was reported.

Explanation:The label of Dettol mentioning that it kills coronavirus is not the recent strain of coronavirus. They have not tested its products for the recent novel coronavirus. Misleading post is getting viral.

https://www.vishvasnews.com/english/health/fact-check-no-dettol-didnt-test-the-2019-novel-coronavirus-strains-misleading-post-getting-viral/

Claim: Post says two patients at Valley Regional Medical Center in Brownsville, Texas, “are being looked at” for possible coronavirus infections.
Explaination: Health officials say there are no coronavirus patients in the Rio Grande Valley as of March 3, 2020.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Post says two patients at Valley Regional Medical Center in Brownsville, Texas, “are being looked at” for possible coronavirus infections.

Explanation:Health officials say there are no coronavirus patients in the Rio Grande Valley as of March 3, 2020.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/03/viral-image/no-brownsville-texas-hospital-isnt-treating-two-co/

Claim: A video has been viewed thousands of times in Facebook posts alongside a claim it shows a Sri Lankan doctor who invented a rapid test kit for the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19.
Explaination: The claim is false; the doctor seen in the video was being interviewed by an Australian television channel to discuss the benefits of rapid COVID-19 testing; the doctor told AFP he was not involved in the development of testing kits.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video has been viewed thousands of times in Facebook posts alongside a claim it shows a Sri Lankan doctor who invented a rapid test kit for the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19.

Explanation:The claim is false; the doctor seen in the video was being interviewed by an Australian television channel to discuss the benefits of rapid COVID-19 testing; the doctor told AFP he was not involved in the development of testing kits.

https://factcheck.afp.com/doctor-interviewed-report-did-not-say-he-was-involved-development-covid-19-test-kits

Claim: “Wisconsin is the only state where all Republicans voted against protecting its citizens.”
Explaination: Wisconsin is indeed the only one of the 50 states where all Republicans voted no. But it’s a bit of an exaggeration to describe that vote as “against protecting its citizens.”
Label: MOSTLY TRUE
html:
Claim: “Wisconsin is the only state where all Republicans voted against protecting its citizens.”

Explanation:Wisconsin is indeed the only one of the 50 states where all Republicans voted no. But it’s a bit of an exaggeration to describe that vote as “against protecting its citizens.”

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/20/facebook-posts/yes-wisconsin-only-state-where-all-republicans-opp/

Claim: A viral WhatsApp voice note in Nigeria claims that the coronavirus could kill up to 45 million Nigerians.
Explaination: This is misleading, as data from the World Health Organization (WHO) and the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) shows. The message makes several other false claims, which we debunk here.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: A viral WhatsApp voice note in Nigeria claims that the coronavirus could kill up to 45 million Nigerians.

Explanation:This is misleading, as data from the World Health Organization (WHO) and the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) shows. The message makes several other false claims, which we debunk here.

https://factcheck.afp.com/viral-whatsapp-voice-note-nigeria-makes-misleading-claims-about-covid-19-fatalities-projections

Claim: Says video shows “the Chinese are destroying the 5G poles as they are aware that it is the thing triggering the corona symptoms.”
Explaination: The video shows Hong Kong protesters tearing down “smart” lampposts because they feared they could be used to collect personal data from citizens.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Says video shows “the Chinese are destroying the 5G poles as they are aware that it is the thing triggering the corona symptoms.”

Explanation:The video shows Hong Kong protesters tearing down “smart” lampposts because they feared they could be used to collect personal data from citizens.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/07/viral-image/no-video-doesnt-show-people-china-destroying-5g-po/

Claim: Italy has mandated no treatment of all elderly patients for coronavirus.
Explaination: The guidelines to ration care to those with higher survivability are only suggestions at this point.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Italy has mandated no treatment of all elderly patients for coronavirus.

Explanation:The guidelines to ration care to those with higher survivability are only suggestions at this point.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471983-Fact-Check-Italy-IS-Considering-NOT-Treating-All-Elderly-With-Coronavirus.html

Claim: Italy’s Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte broke down publicly due to the ongoing coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: The image viral on social media is of Brazilian President Bolsonaro and not of Italy's PM Giuseppe Conte. The claim shared by several Social media users and media outlets is hence false.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Italy’s Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte broke down publicly due to the ongoing coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:The image viral on social media is of Brazilian President Bolsonaro and not of Italy's PM Giuseppe Conte. The claim shared by several Social media users and media outlets is hence false.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15335640

Claim: Cristiano Ronaldo is going to transform his hotels into hospitals.
Explaination: It’s not true that the Portuguese football player is doing this. Observador spoke with sources close to the Hotels and the player and found out that it was false.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Cristiano Ronaldo is going to transform his hotels into hospitals.

Explanation:It’s not true that the Portuguese football player is doing this. Observador spoke with sources close to the Hotels and the player and found out that it was false.

https://observador.pt/factchecks/fact-check-cristiano-ronaldo-vai-transformar-os-seus-hoteis-em-hospitais/

Claim: Alcohol kills the coronavirus.
Explaination: Post claiming alcohol kills coronavirus is fake.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Alcohol kills the coronavirus.

Explanation:Post claiming alcohol kills coronavirus is fake.

https://www.vishvasnews.com/english/health/fact-check-post-claiming-alcohol-kills-coronavirus-is-fake/

Claim: Policemen in China chase COVID-19 in a subway station.
Explaination: Please click the link to read the full article
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Policemen in China chase COVID-19 in a subway station.

Explanation:Please click the link to read the full article

http://www.ecuadorchequea.com/las-mentiras-sobre-el-covid-19-en-ecuador/

Claim: Can cannabis cure coronavirus?
Explaination: The image has been created with the help of a website called dopl3r. No government mandate or science research or WHO have commented on cannabis and if it can cure coronavirus or not.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Can cannabis cure coronavirus?

Explanation:The image has been created with the help of a website called dopl3r. No government mandate or science research or WHO have commented on cannabis and if it can cure coronavirus or not.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_14792103

Claim: An image with human body figurines in a bowl that claims China is serving human baby soup in its restaurants.
Explaination: The image is of an art installation to raise awareness about the rampant killing of sharks.
Label: False
html:
Claim: An image with human body figurines in a bowl that claims China is serving human baby soup in its restaurants.

Explanation:The image is of an art installation to raise awareness about the rampant killing of sharks.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/2015-photo-falsely-shared-as-amit-shah-visiting-covid-19-patients-7380?check=2

Claim: Drinking tea can help cure COVID-19.
Explaination: There is no evidence that drinking tea can help mitigate the effects of the coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Drinking tea can help cure COVID-19.

Explanation:There is no evidence that drinking tea can help mitigate the effects of the coronavirus.

https://www.thejournal.ie/debunked-drinking-tea-covid-19-coronavirus-5057320-Mar2020/

Claim: First coronavirus case in Ambato, Ecuador.
Explaination: Please click the link to read the full article
Label: False
ann23_remarks: the alleged claim about the first coronavirus case doesn't seem to be what's in the article, so it's confusing what is meant here.
html:
Claim: First coronavirus case in Ambato, Ecuador.

Explanation:Please click the link to read the full article

http://www.ecuadorchequea.com/ecuador-10-casos-positivos-para-coronavirus/?fbclid=IwAR1i-e5y3cPTG5WPJhuipV9cA_Ly5vPlz2dBTtczgID5peTbenUb7B8gCEg?check=1

Claim: Videos showing police detaining COVID-19 patients in India.
Explaination: These were mock drills that were conducted by the UP Police to determine the preparedness of the public with regards to COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Videos showing police detaining COVID-19 patients in India.

Explanation:These were mock drills that were conducted by the UP Police to determine the preparedness of the public with regards to COVID-19.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/mock-drill-videos-passed-off-as-police-detaining-suspected-covid-19-patients-7378

Claim: “The Chinese Communist Party is using Zoom as a way to spy on our citizens.”
Explaination: The claim is based on a report from researchers at the University of Toronto. But one of the researchers told us that while they identified security issues with Zoom, whether China has exploited the platform for espionage was not something they considered.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: “The Chinese Communist Party is using Zoom as a way to spy on our citizens.”

Explanation:The claim is based on a report from researchers at the University of Toronto. But one of the researchers told us that while they identified security issues with Zoom, whether China has exploited the platform for espionage was not something they considered.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/07/charlie-kirk/china-spying-you-through-zoom-charlie-kirk-oversta/

Claim: Gargling warm salt water or vinegar prevents coronavirus infection.
Explaination: The claim is false; international health authorities and experts do not list gargling as an effective remedy or prevention method for COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Gargling warm salt water or vinegar prevents coronavirus infection.

Explanation:The claim is false; international health authorities and experts do not list gargling as an effective remedy or prevention method for COVID-19.

https://factcheck.afp.com/gargling-warm-salt-water-or-vinegar-does-not-prevent-coronavirus-infection-health-experts-say?check=1

Claim: People rioting on the streets of London due to economic crisis in the wake of coronavirus outbreak.
Explaination: The viral video is almost nine years old and from the London riots in 2011.
Label: False
html:
Claim: People rioting on the streets of London due to economic crisis in the wake of coronavirus outbreak.

Explanation:The viral video is almost nine years old and from the London riots in 2011.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-truth-behind-video-people-rioting-on-london-streets-fearing-coronavirus-lockdown-1658310-2020-03-22

Claim: Photo of coffins of coronavirus patients who died in a single day in Italy.
Explaination: The picture is indeed from Italy but is seven years old and has nothing to do with the coronavirus outbreak.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Photo of coffins of coronavirus patients who died in a single day in Italy.

Explanation:The picture is indeed from Italy but is seven years old and has nothing to do with the coronavirus outbreak.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/picture-coffins-no-relation-covid19-coronavirus-deaths-italy-1658475-2020-03-22

Claim: An audio clip of Dr. Naresh Trehan cautioning people about the danger of COVID-19 in India.
Explaination: The audio is not of Dr. Trehan, nor has he ever said what is said in this audio recording.
Label: False
html:
Claim: An audio clip of Dr. Naresh Trehan cautioning people about the danger of COVID-19 in India.

Explanation:The audio is not of Dr. Trehan, nor has he ever said what is said in this audio recording.

https://aajtak.intoday.in/story/fact-check-dr-naresh-trehan-coronavirus-covid-19-social-media-viral-post-1-1176172.html

Claim: Drinking lots of water and gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar eliminates the novel coronavirus. Spread the information as you can save someone.
Explaination: According to GMA news report, saline gargles or gargling with water and salt will provide no protection against or cure for the 2019 novel coronavirus acute respiratory disease (2019-nCoV ARD). The report also carried a statement by the Dr. Eric Domingo “I think this is a home remedy that has been followed for many, many generations and I don't think there’s going to be any harm in doing it. Saline gargle has always been advocated to improve mostly symptoms of sore throat...I don't think there is any evidence that it will kill a virus,” Domingo said.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Drinking lots of water and gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar eliminates the novel coronavirus. Spread the information as you can save someone.

Explanation:According to GMA news report, saline gargles or gargling with water and salt will provide no protection against or cure for the 2019 novel coronavirus acute respiratory disease (2019-nCoV ARD). The report also carried a statement by the Dr. Eric Domingo “I think this is a home remedy that has been followed for many, many generations and I don't think there’s going to be any harm in doing it. Saline gargle has always been advocated to improve mostly symptoms of sore throat...I don't think there is any evidence that it will kill a virus,” Domingo said.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15211727

Claim: Hindu man in Rajasthan killed by Muslims amidst lockdown.
Explaination: The video is originally from Pakistan where a man was maimed by his wife's relatives.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Hindu man in Rajasthan killed by Muslims amidst lockdown.

Explanation:The video is originally from Pakistan where a man was maimed by his wife's relatives.

https://www.factcrescendo.com/fact-check-hindu-man-killed-by-muslims-in-rajasthan/

Claim: A front page article by the Southern Times cautioning against travel to Kenya because of the growing number of cases in Kenya.
Explaination: The Southern Times published a post denouncing the front page, and the image appears to be a doctored version of a previous edition of the paper.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A front page article by the Southern Times cautioning against travel to Kenya because of the growing number of cases in Kenya.

Explanation:The Southern Times published a post denouncing the front page, and the image appears to be a doctored version of a previous edition of the paper.

https://pesacheck.org/false-this-newspaper-front-page-cautioning-against-travel-to-kenya-due-to-covid-19-is-fake-bbb9c3bc3580?source=rss----ab41f21aa9a9---4

Claim: A photo of a man and woman embracing has been shared on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim that it shows two Italian doctors who died from COVID-19 after contracting the disease from the patients they treated.
Explaination: The claim is false; this is an Associated Press photo of a couple kissing at an airport in Barcelona, Spain.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A photo of a man and woman embracing has been shared on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim that it shows two Italian doctors who died from COVID-19 after contracting the disease from the patients they treated.

Explanation:The claim is false; this is an Associated Press photo of a couple kissing at an airport in Barcelona, Spain.

https://factcheck.afp.com/photo-has-circulated-reports-about-couple-airport-barcelona-march-2020?check=2

Claim: Last picture of Indonesian Dr. Hadio Alo bidding farewell to his family.
Explaination: This image was uploaded in Malaysia and this is not related to Indonesia.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Last picture of Indonesian Dr. Hadio Alo bidding farewell to his family.

Explanation:This image was uploaded in Malaysia and this is not related to Indonesia.

https://srilanka.factcrescendo.com/tamil/fact-check-is-that-last-picture-of-indonesian-doctor-hadio-ali/

Claim: Coronavirus dies at a temperature above 26-27 degrees Celsius as per UNICEF.
Explaination: The viral message on novel coronavirus is NOT issued by UNICEF.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Coronavirus dies at a temperature above 26-27 degrees Celsius as per UNICEF.

Explanation:The viral message on novel coronavirus is NOT issued by UNICEF.
